To simplify 3(x + 2)², first expand (x + 2)² as (x + 2)(x + 2). Using the distributive property: Multiply x by x to get x², x by 2 to get 2x, 2 by x to get 2x, and 2 by 2 to get 4. Combine all terms: x² + 2x + 2x + 4 simplifies to x² + 4x + 4. Now, multiply this result by 3: 3(x² + 4x + 4) = 3x² + 12x + 12. The simplified expression is: 3x² + 12x + 12.
